Lots of people marry for what's essentially obligation. Society, family, and culture reinforce at basically all times that the further you go past 25 without a job, a spouse, and a baby, the more of a failure you are. Anyone here reading this should be intimately familiar with at least the nagging sensation that the people you explain yourself to are judging you as not sufficiently masculine/feminine/grown-up for respectability, and that's if you don't have the sort of parents who just say it to your face.

It's kind of funny.. my original thoughts reading this was that the wife definitely knows and either doesn't care or supports them. Then, reading the afterward where she says the wife is married to him more out of obligation than love, it really makes sense. She definitely knows. Honestly it's quite silly to me, why would this woman marry a man she doesn't love out of obligation? Towards who? It's not like a marriage of convenience for either family. The grounds for which they tried to make it so we don't feel bad for the wife due to her apparent natural indifference to her husband feels a bit shallow.
